title: Home
text:
I work as a student researcher under Chris Qin at WSU Vancouver. My work involves predicting the generated power and revenue of wind farms under variable turbulence and market conditions. I have presented some of my findings at the IEEE Big Data 2024 conference in Washington D.C. and am currently working on a journal paper version.


Data-Driven Modeling of Wind Farm Power and Revenue Generation (PDF, IEEE Xplore)







Created a program for visualizing and checking the validity of petal projections, a construct in knot theory.

title: About
text: I am an undergraduate student currently studying Mathematics and Statistics at UCLA. In the past I have mostly applied my skills doing mathematical research in fields such as matroid and knot theory. More recently I have been working as a student researcher at a wind energy lab attempting to predict wind farm power and revenue generation under turbulent conditions. At present I am mostly interested in research on renewable energy and climate science.
